thread.title: Portlanders hold vigil for Umpqua Community College victims (photos)
thread.title_full: Portlanders hold vigil for Umpqua Community College victims (photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portlanders hold vigil for Umpqua Community College victims (photos)
text:
In a show of solidarity with their neighbors to the south, Portlanders came together to pay respects to the victims of a mass shooting with prayers, music and candlelight.
About 100 people were on hand as members of the Oregon Symphony performed classical music, such as "Air" by Bach, Thursday night in front of Portland City Hall. The morning shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg left 10 dead, including the gunman, and seven injured.
With tears running down her face, the 23-year-old Karla Andrade said the shooting hit home for her because she's a student.
Candlelight vigil held for victims of UCC shooting A candlelight vigil was held Thursday night at Stewart Park in Roseburg for the victims of the Umpqua Community College shooting earlier in the day.
"It happened in Roseburg, but it could have easily happened here in Portland," said Andrade, of Klamath Falls. She added that the world needs more love, and that's why she made an effort to attend the vigil.
"I felt like I needed to show solidarity as a fellow student and human being who hurts to see other people hurt," Andrade said.
The gathering was orchestrated by the Portland City Council and timed to coincide with a prayer vigil in Roseburg. Portland Mayor Charlie Hales opened the floor; he was followed various faith leaders who spoke about looking to a higher power for guidance.
